content.description: A finger crack in a dihedral leads to an obvious break at the halfway point. From here, step 1' to the left and climb the handcrack in the corner.
content.protection: SR to 2". 2 bolt anchor w/ rings.
content.location: Start on the left end of the upper, South face.

content.description: I am not sure of the name, but it's the leftmost route on the SW face.  Climb up nasty crimps past 2 bolts.  The crux is the bottom, so a stick clip is recommended.
content.protection: 2 bolts on the face and one over the corner.  There are better shunts on the top if you want to finish the juggy section on the right.
content.location: First route on the left past 2 bolts with an obvious juggy sidepull in the middle.

content.description: This is the second line of bolts from the left on the SW face.  Begin at a white-ish ramp in the center of the face and work your way up to a big sidepull, then onto crimps for the finish.
content.protection: 2 bolts on the face.  Could bring a medium-sized cam for the top section or run it out (5.5) to the shunts.  2 bolts and rap rings at the top.
content.location: This ascends the center of the SW face.  It is the 2nd line of bolts from the left.

content.description: This has hard to protect face climbing.  There are a few underclings and sidepulls with little feet.  The crux is at the start.
content.location:
It is left of "

5.11d

" (and shares anchors).

content.description: This route is right of the 5.7 OW and follows the crack out right to an eye bolt then straight up.
content.protection: Large/medium stoppers and possibly a small/medium cam for the initial crack, one eye bolt, then one or two medium sized cams. After the eye bolt an orange and yellow master cam worked well for the finishing moves.
content.location: It is the farthest route right on the south face of Pump Station.

content.description: This used to be a mixed, 3 bolt climb, but two bolts have been added.  Offers fun climbing up a crimper face.
content.protection: 5 bolts to a two bolt anchor or skip the 4th bolt and protect with gear.
content.location: This is the leftmost climb on the Southwest-facing wall.

content.description:
P1. The first pitch climbs a short crack on quality rock to a two bolt anchor.

P2. The second pitch climbs up broken cracks and ledges through the most right crack system to a two bolt anchor at the top.

You can either rap with one 70 meter rope with rope stretch, rappel twice with a 60m rope, or walk off.
content.location:
Start in a hand crack on the Southwestern face between "

Climbers Just Want To Have Fun!

" and "Chimney, 5.6."

content.description: Climb a fun short slab past 3 bolts to anchors.

climbs.name: Climbers Just Want To Have Fun!

content.description: The first pitch is fairly straightforward - climb right of SW arÃªte past 1 bolt to ramp. The 2nd pitch continue up the cracks or dihedral. The crack system just left of Pockets is the easiest, with Right Angle crack at 5.6.
Offwidth to a small roof to more offwidth. As a 5.7 offwidth, it should also be understood that there are plenty of face holds.
content.protection: A small standard rack to 3" protects the climb well. A 4-5" piece is optional. 2 bolt anchor with rings.
content.location: This route starts up the hill on the South face, maybe 20 feet left of the chimney with the chockstone in it.

content.description:
Start on a finger crack on climber's left of Pumpstation, climb the crack, passing a bolt up top to a set of eyebolts (5.7-8). Belay here, or continue up the obvious dihedral to a set of rap anchors up top (5.9).

This route is a good moderate trad route for the area, with good protection at the crux, and decent exposure.

Use extreme caution if lowering from the top with a sixty meter rope.*
content.protection: Standard rack, extra runners are very useful if doing it in one pitch to minimize rope drag.

content.description: Climb up a short face with a mixture of crimps and underclings.
content.protection: 4 bolts + possible gear to protect run out at the top. To a two bolt anchor.
content.location:
Climb the most right route on the west-facing side, just left of "

Climbers Just Want To Have Fun!

."
